definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to break/to destroy/to devastate/to ravage/to repress

sentences.english: The great friendship and militant solidarity between the peoples of our two countries are unbreakable.
sentences.chinese: 我们两国人民的伟大友谊与战斗团结是坚不可摧的。

sentences.english: The evidence that the yuan is significantly undervalued is hardly rock-solid.
sentences.chinese: 人民币明显定值过低的证据并非坚不可摧。

sentences.english: The strongest moat you can build is one based on strong relationships.
sentences.chinese: 你能建的最坚不可摧的护城河是建立在牢固的关系上。

sentences.english: The walls built by Poseidon and Apollo were impregnable5).
sentences.chinese: 波塞冬和阿波罗建造的城墙坚不可摧。

sentences.english: The Chinese people have an unshakable determination to defend our core interests.
sentences.chinese: 中国人民捍卫自己核心利益的决心是坚不可摧的。

sentences.english: The ocean seems invulnerable because it is vast and under-explored.
sentences.chinese: 海洋看似坚不可摧因为它广博而且未经充分开发。
我觉得坚不可摧，觉得自由。

sentences.english: His opponents were still obsessed by his seeming invulnerability .
sentences.chinese: 他的对手还仍然对他表面上的坚不可摧感到棘手。
今天，谷歌似乎坚不可摧。

definition: solid as a boulder (idiom); absolutely secure/rock-firm and unyielding
no stronghold one cannot overcome (idiom); to conquer every obstacle/nothing one can't do/to carry everything before one
secure as a city protected by a wall of metal and a moat of boiling water (idiom)/well fortified/invulnerable to attack
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
copper wall, iron bastion (idiom); impenetrable defense
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
to collapse and fall apart (idiom); to break up/falling to pieces
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
